constraints.constraint: API Design: RESTful endpoint POST /api/auth/register with Zod validation on both client and server
Password hashing: bcrypt with 10 rounds (OWASP standard)
Rate limiting: 5 requests/hour per IP to prevent spam registrations
Input validation: Server-side validation is mandatory (client-side for UX only)
RLS policies must ensure users can only read their own family data
Foreign key constraints: users.family_id → families.id with CASCADE delete
Family key must be generated using Epic 7 generateFamilyKey() function
Invite code format must be: FAMILY-XXXX:BASE64KEY where XXXX is 8 random alphanumeric chars
Family key must be stored in IndexedDB via initializeFamilyKey() before redirect
Use React Hook Form + Zod for form state management and validation
Display success toast with invite code using Sonner library (10 second duration)
Use shadcn/ui Tabs component for login screen interface

interface.name: generateFamilyKey
interface.signature: async function generateFamilyKey(): Promise<{ familyKey: CryptoKey; base64Key: string }>
interface.usage: Call during registration to generate family encryption key. Returns both CryptoKey and base64-encoded string for invite code.

interface.name: createInviteCodeWithKey
interface.signature: function createInviteCodeWithKey(inviteCode: string, base64Key: string): string
interface.usage: Call to format invite code with embedded key. Combines FAMILY-XXXX code with base64 key using : separator.

interface.name: initializeFamilyKey
interface.usage: Call after successful registration to store family key in IndexedDB. Must be called before redirect to /chat.

interface.name: registerSchema
interface.signature: z.object({ email: z.string().email(), password: z.string().min(8), familyName: z.string().min(2).max(50), userName: z.string().min(2).max(50) })
interface.usage: Use for validating registration form input on both client and server. Export as registerSchema constant.

interface.name: POST /api/auth/register
interface.signature: Request: { email, password, familyName, userName } → Response: { success, user, family: { inviteCode }, session }
interface.usage: CreateForm component calls this endpoint. Returns user data, family with invite code, and session tokens.

tests.standards: Testing framework: Vitest for unit/integration tests, Playwright for E2E tests. Unit tests: 95% code coverage target for auth utilities and API logic. Integration tests: Test full API flows with database operations. E2E tests: Test user flows through UI (form submission, validation, success states). Test file naming: *.test.ts for unit tests, *.spec.ts for E2E tests. Test location: tests/unit/ for unit tests, tests/integration/ for integration tests, tests/e2e/ for E2E tests.
